title: 1984 by George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that depicts a totalitarian society where the government controls every aspect of people's lives.

title: A Tale of Two Cities by Charles Dickens
description: A novel set during the French Revolution about the lives of two men, Charles Darnay and Sydney Carton, and their love for the same woman.

title: American Gods by Neil Gaiman
description: A novel about a man named Shadow who becomes embroiled in a war between the old gods of mythology and the new gods of technology and media.

title: Animal Farm by George Orwell
description: A satirical novel about a group of farm animals that overthrow their oppressive human owners.

title: Atonement by Ian McEwan
description: A novel about a young girl who falsely accuses her older sister's lover of a crime, and the consequences of her actions over the course of several decades.

title: Beloved by Toni Morrison
description: A novel about a former slave named Sethe and her daughter Denver, who are haunted by the ghost of Sethe's dead baby.

title: Blood Meridian by Cormac McCarthy
description: A novel about a teenage runaway who joins a band of ruthless hunters in the American Southwest and witnesses their brutal violence and exploitation.

title: Brave New World by Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where people are conditioned and controlled from birth.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone by J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, about a young wizard named Harry who learns about his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad
description: A novel about a journey up the Congo River into the heart of the African continent, where a man named Kurtz has established a brutal and tyrannical rule.

title: Invisible Man by Ralph Ellison
description: A novel about a young black man's search for identity in a racially oppressive society.

title: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte
description: A novel about a young governess named Jane who falls in love with her brooding and mysterious employer, Mr. Rochester.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha by Arthur Golden
description: A novel about the life of a Japanese geisha in the 1930s.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A novel about the Buendia family and their generations of love, magic, and tragedy.

title: Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen
description: A classic novel about the Bennet sisters and their quest for love and marriage in 19th century England.

title: The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho
description: A novel about a young shepherd's spiritual journey to find his destiny.

title: The Alice Books by Lewis Carroll
description: A series of books about a young girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole into a strange and fantastical world.

title: The Book Thief by Markus Zusak
description: A novel about a young girl in Nazi Germany who steals books to help her cope with her situation.

title: The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel about a teenage boy named Holden Caulfield who is struggling with feelings of alienation and confusion.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia by C.S. Lewis
description: A series of fantasy novels about the adventures of four children in a magical world.

title: The Color Purple by Alice Walker
description: A novel about the life of a black woman named Celie and her journey from poverty and oppression to self-discovery and independence.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl by Anne Frank
description: A diary of a Jewish girl's life in hiding during the Holocaust.

title: The Grapes of Wrath by John Steinbeck
description: A novel set during the Great Depression about a poor family of Oklahoma farmers who travel to California in search of a better life.

title: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the pursuit of the American Dream in the 1920s.

title: The Harry Potter Series by J.K. Rowling
description: A series of fantasy novels about a young wizard's adventures at Hogwarts.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams
description: A science fiction comedy about an unwitting human and his alien friend who travel through space and encounter bizarre and absurd creatures.

title: The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prequel to The Lord of the Rings, about a hobbit named Bilbo who sets out on a quest with a group of dwarves to reclaim their treasure from a dragon.

title: The Hunger Games Trilogy by Suzanne Collins
description: A trilogy of dystopian novels about a young girl's fight to survive a deadly competition.

title: The Kite Runner by Khaled Hosseini
description: A novel about the friendship between two Afghan boys and the tragic events that tear them apart.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness by Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A science fiction novel about a diplomat who travels to a planet where the inhabitants can change their gender at will.

title: The Lord of the Flies by William Golding
description: A novel about a group of boys stranded on an island who revert to savagery.

title: The Lord of the Rings by J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A epic fantasy novel about a hobbit named Frodo who sets out on a quest to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle Earth.

title: The Martian by Andy Weir
description: A science fiction novel about an astronaut named Mark Watney who is stranded on Mars and must find a way to survive and signal for rescue.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray by Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man named Dorian who remains young and beautiful while his portrait ages and reflects the evil within him.

title: The Remains of the Day by Kazuo Ishiguro
description: A novel about a butler who reflects on his life and career in the service of an English lord in the years leading up to World War II.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle by Haruki Murakami
description: A surreal and philosophical novel about a man named Toru Okade who embarks on a journey to find his missing wife and encounters strange and mysterious characters along the way.

title: Things Fall Apart by Chinua Achebe
description: A novel about the clash between traditional Igbo culture and the effects of British colonialism in Nigeria.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee
description: A novel set in the 1930s about a young girl named Scout who witnesses the racism and prejudice in her small town of Maycomb, Alabama.

title: Wuthering Heights by Emily Bronte
description: A novel about the intense and passionate love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe by C.S. Lewis
description: A fantasy novel about four children who discover a magical world in an old wardrobe.

title: The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown
description: A mystery novel about a symbologist who discovers a centuries-old secret.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain
description: A classic novel about a young boy's adventures along the Mississippi River.

title: The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo by Stieg Larsson
description: A mystery novel about a hacker and a journalist investigating a decades-old murder.

title: The Old Man and the Sea by Ernest Hemingway
description: A classic novel about an old fisherman's struggle with a giant marlin.

title: The Fault in Our Stars by John Green
description: A story of two teenage cancer patients who find love and hope in each other.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain
description: A classic novel about a young boy's adventures along the Mississippi River.

title: The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A story about a young prince who visits different planets and learns about life.
